com.paypal.selion.proxy

Class SeLionRemoteProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openqa.grid.internal.BaseRemoteProxy
      • org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy
        • com.paypal.selion.proxy.SeLionRemoteProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<org.openqa.grid.internal.RemoteProxy>, org.openqa.grid.internal.listeners.CommandListener, org.openqa.grid.internal.listeners.SelfHealingProxy, org.openqa.grid.internal.listeners.TestSessionListener, org.openqa.grid.internal.listeners.TimeoutListener, org.openqa.grid.internal.RemoteProxy

    public class SeLionRemoteProxy
extends org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy
    This is a customized DefaultRemoteProxy for SeLion. This proxy when injected into the Grid, starts counting unique test sessions. After "n" test sessions, the proxy unhooks the node gracefully from the grid and self terminates gracefully. The number of unique sessions is controlled via a json config file : "SeLionConfig.json". A typical entry in this file looks like: 
      "uniqueSessionCount": 25
    Here UniqueSessionCount represents the max. number of tests that the node will run before recycling itself.
